I'm thinking of using a combination of scene headings, lighting, and sound cues to guide the audience through the non-linear narrative. I want to create a sense of fluidity between the past and present, so I'll use transitions that blur the lines between the different time periods. For example, I might use a fade-to-black or a sudden shift in lighting to signal a jump in time. I'll also use sound cues, such as music or sound effects, to evoke a sense of nostalgia or to create a sense of continuity between scenes.

In terms of balancing the past and present, I'll make sure that each flashback or memory serves a purpose in revealing character insights or deepening relationships. I don't want the flashbacks to feel like gratuitous additions, but rather as essential pieces of the narrative puzzle.
